CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1973, pg. 21 reads: "Namesake - This young lad, 6 year-old son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Williams, 4367 Chatsworth Ave., Hazelwood, is quite proud to bear the name of the Pirates baseball star, Roberto Clemente, and was so hurt over the sad news of Clemente's tragic death that he could hardly force a smile for the picture. His Mother, Mrs. Jetta Ball Williams tries to help her young son understand, and attempts to bouy his spirits by re-telling the story of the fond friendship which existed between his Dad, Tom Williams, a former Boston Red Sox player and Roberto Clemente, the star of his dreams. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Roberto Clemente Williams wearing Pittsburgh Pirates baseball cap, and mother Jetta Ball Williams holding baseball bat
